{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2021}} {{short description|American progressive metal band}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Between the Buried and Me | image = BTBAM.jpg | image_size = | landscape = yes | caption = Between the Buried and Me performing in August 2018
From left to right: [[Paul Waggoner]], [[Tommy Giles Rogers Jr.]], [[Blake Richardson (drummer)|Blake Richardson]], [[Dan Briggs (musician)|Dan Briggs]], [[Dustie Waring]] | origin = [[Raleigh, North Carolina]], US | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Progressive metal]] * [[technical death metal]] * [[progressive metalcore]] * [[avant-garde metal]] * [[metalcore]] }} | years_active = 2000–present | label = {{flatlist| * [[Lifeforce Records|Lifeforce]] * [[Victory Records|Victory]] * [[Metal Blade Records|Metal Blade]] * [[Sumerian Records|Sumerian]] }} | associated_acts = {{flatlist| * [[Glass Casket]] * [[Prayer for Cleansing]] * [[Trioscapes]] * [[Orbs (band)|Orbs]] * [[Oh, Sleeper]] * Nova Collective }} | website = | current_members = * [[Tommy Giles Rogers Jr.|Tommy Giles Rogers]] * [[Paul Waggoner]] * Dustie Waring * [[Dan Briggs (musician)|Dan Briggs]] * [[Blake Richardson (drummer)|Blake Richardson]] | past_members = * Will Goodyear * Nicholas Fletcher * Jason King * [[Mark Castillo]] * Kevin Falk * [[Shane Blay]] * Jason Roe }} '''Between the Buried and Me''', often abbreviated as '''BTBAM''', is an American [[progressive metal]] band from [[Raleigh, North Carolina]]. Formed in 2000, the band consists of [[Tommy Giles Rogers Jr.]] (lead vocals, keyboards), [[Paul Waggoner]] (lead guitar, backing vocals), Dustie Waring (rhythm guitar, lead guitar), [[Dan Briggs (musician)|Dan Briggs]] (bass, keyboards), and [[Blake Richardson (drummer)|Blake Richardson]] (drums). Their [[Between the Buried and Me (album)|debut eponymous album]] was released through [[Lifeforce Records]] in 2002, shifting to [[Victory Records]] for subsequent releases until their signing to [[Metal Blade Records|Metal Blade]] in 2011, where Between the Buried and Me released their first [[extended play]], ''[[The Parallax: Hypersleep Dialogues]]'' that year, and its full-length follow-up ''[[The Parallax II: Future Sequence]]'' the following year. Their seventh studio album, ''[[Coma Ecliptic]]'', was released in July 2015. Their eighth album ''[[Automata I]]'' was released in March 2018, and their ninth album, ''[[Automata II]]'', was released in July 2018. Their tenth album, ''[[Colors II]]'' (a follow up to 2007's [[Colors (Between the Buried and Me album)|''Colors'']]), was released in August 2021. ==History== ===Formation and eponymous album (2000–2002)=== The band was formed in 2000 in [[Raleigh, North Carolina|Raleigh]], [[North Carolina]] after the demise of the metalcore bands From Here On and [[Prayer for Cleansing]], of which Rogers, Waggoner, and Goodyear were members.{{Cite web|last=Julien|first=Alexandre|date=November 3, 2011|title=Redstar Records Interview|url=http://www.abridgedpause.com/redstarrecords|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131214204756/http://www.abridgedpause.com/redstarrecords|archive-date=December 14, 2013|access-date=September 12, 2020|website=Abridged Pause Blog|language=en-US}} Nick Fletcher and Jason King subsequently joined on guitar and bass respectively. The name "Between the Buried and Me" was chosen after a section of lyrics in the [[Counting Crows]] song "[[August and Everything After#Track listing|Ghost Train]]". Between the Buried and Me's first release was a demo containing three songs, all of which were re-recorded for the band's [[Between the Buried and Me (album)|self-titled debut album]], released through [[Lifeforce Records]] in 2002. The song "Aspirations" became the band's first music video. The album was not initially successful but did manage to catch the attention of [[Victory Records]], to which they later signed. Victory reissued the album in 2004 as an [[enhanced CD]]. The band toured in support of their first album with Canadian metalcore group The End.{{cite book|author=Garry Sharpe-Young|title=New Wave of American Heavy Metal|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=uIIf03bGyAAC&pg=PA315|year=2005|publisher=Zonda Books Limited|isbn=978-0-9582684-0-0|pages=315–}} ===''The Silent Circus'', ''Alaska'', and ''The Anatomy Of'' (2003–2006)=== In August 2003, Between the Buried and Me traveled to [[Q Division Studios]] in [[Somerville, Massachusetts]] to record their second record, ''[[The Silent Circus]]'', released in October the same year. It was later re-released in 2006 with a live DVD of the band's performance at The Cat's Cradle in [[Chapel Hill, North Carolina]] on July 17, 2005. Mark Castillo played drums on ''The Silent Circus'', replacing Goodyear. After the release of ''The Silent Circus'', the band went through numerous members before the current lineup was assembled for their third album, ''[[Alaska (Between the Buried and Me album)|Alaska]]''. On drums, [[Mark Castillo]] was replaced by Jason Roe, and later by [[Blake Richardson (drummer)|Blake Richardson]]. On guitar, Fletcher was replaced by [[Shane Blay]], and later by Dustie Waring. And on bass, King was replaced by Kevin Falk, and later by [[Dan Briggs (musician)|Dan Briggs]]. This remains the current lineup. In September 2005, Between the Buried and Me released ''Alaska''. The album released the songs "Selkies: The Endless Obsession", "The Primer", and "Backwards Marathon" as singles. In the following year, the band released their first cover album, ''[[The Anatomy Of]]'', a collection of covers of bands that influenced them, including [[Metallica]], [[King Crimson]], [[Pantera]], [[Faith No More]], [[Queen (band)|Queen]], [[Pink Floyd]], [[Earth Crisis]], [[Counting Crows]], and [[Soundgarden]]. In early 2006, Between the Buried and Me was on tour supporting [[Bleeding Through]] along with [[Every Time I Die]] and [[Haste the Day]]. They were also on the [[Ozzfest]] 2006 Second Stage.{{cite web |url=http://www.live-metal.net/concertreports_ozzfest2006.html |title=The 'Prince of Darkness' sees the light |date=August 6, 2006 |work=LiveMetalNet |access-date=October 3, 2010}} In late 2006, they were on the Radio Rebellion Tour headlined by [[Norma Jean (band)|Norma Jean]].{{cite web |author=Greg Maki |url=http://www.smnnews.com/2006/07/25/radio-rebellion-tour-2006-feat-norma-jean-between-the-buried-and-me-fbtmof-misery-signals-nd-more |title=Radio Rebellion Tour 2006 – Feat. Norma Jean, Between the Buried and Me, FBTMOF, Misery Signals, nd More |work=SMN News |access-date=October 3, 2010 |date=July 26, 2006 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120415061358/http://www.smnnews.com/2006/07/25/radio-rebellion-tour-2006-feat-norma-jean-between-the-buried-and-me-fbtmof-misery-signals-nd-more/ |archive-date=April 15, 2012 |url-status=dead }} ===''Colors'' and ''The Great Misdirect'' (2007–2009)=== In September 2007, Between the Buried and Me released their fourth studio album (fifth if including ''The Anatomy Of''), ''[[Colors (Between the Buried and Me album)|Colors]]''. Band members called it "a 65 minute opus of non stop pummeling beautiful music... we have described this release as '[[New wave music|new wave]] [[polka]] [[grunge]]'."{{cite web |url=http://betweentheburiedandme.com/alaska/ |title=Between the Buried and Me quote |publisher=Betweentheburiedandme.com |date=June 13, 2007 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070708014511/http://betweentheburiedandme.com/alaska/ |archive-date=July 8, 2007 }} The band also described the album as "[[adult contemporary music|adult contemporary]] progressive [[death metal]]".{{cite web |url=http://www.metalunderground.com/news/details.cfm?newsid=26849 |title=Between the Buried and Me Post Studio Update – in Metal News |publisher=Metal Underground.com |date=June 15, 2007 |access-date=July 4, 2011}} In September 2007, after the release of ''[[Colors (Between the Buried and Me album)|Colors]]'', the band went on tour with [[Animosity (band)|Animosity]] and [[Horse the Band]]. Giant (now known as BraveYoung) also supported their shows in the US. The run concluded with their November 4 appearance at the Saints and Sinners Fest in Asbury Park, New Jersey. In December 2007, they again embarked on a headlining tour, supported by [[August Burns Red]] and [[Behold... The Arctopus]]. The band were also the main support on [[The Dillinger Escape Plan]]'s 2008 UK tour. Between the Buried and Me were one of the acts that took part at "Progressive Nation '08", the first in what became an annual [[Progressive rock|progressive music]] festival, also featuring [[Dream Theater]], [[Opeth]], and [[3 (American band)|3]]. Starting in summer 2008 and continuing in the fall, they performed as a supporting act for [[Children of Bodom]]'s US headlining tour, alongside [[The Black Dahlia Murder (band)|The Black Dahlia Murder]]. In early December 2008, they went on a short four-show tour around the Carolinas and Georgia (US) with other bands from the Carolinas, such as [[He Is Legend]], [[Advent (band)|Advent]], and Nightbear. Between the Buried and Me finished a month-long tour of Australia on January 9 with headliners [[Bleeding Through]], [[As Blood Runs Black]], In Trenches, and [[The Abandonment]]. In September 2009, Between the Buried and Me performed a Canadian Tour with [[Killswitch Engage]] and [[In Flames]] co-headlining, along with the support of [[Protest the Hero]].{{cite web |url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=122289 |title=IN FLAMES, KILLSWITCH ENGAGE To Team Up For Canadian Tour |work=Blabbermouth |access-date=May 8, 2010 |date=June 20, 2009}} On May 31, 2009, the group went into the studio to record their fifth album (sixth if including ''The Anatomy Of''), ''[[The Great Misdirect]]''. They released the single "[[Obfuscation (song)|Obfuscation]]" on September 29 and the album on October 27. ===''The Parallax'' and Metal Blade Records (2010–2014)=== In February 2010, Between the Buried and Me supported [[Mastodon (band)|Mastodon]] along with [[Baroness (band)|Baroness]] on their US headlining tour. During the summer of 2010, they were on the Cool Tour with [[As I Lay Dying (band)|As I Lay Dying]], [[Underoath]], [[War of Ages]], [[The Acacia Strain]], [[Architects (British band)|Architects]], [[Cancer Bats]], and [[Blessthefall]].{{cite web |url=http://www.cooltour10.com/lineup.html |title=Cool Tour 2010 lineup |work=Cool Tour |access-date=May 8, 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100615000414/http://www.cooltour10.com/lineup.html |archive-date=June 15, 2010}} In early 2010, Between the Buried and Me toured across North America with [[Cynic (band)|Cynic]], [[Devin Townsend]], and [[Scale the Summit]].{{cite web |url=http://music.msn.com/superfans/heavy-metal/blog/between-the-buried-and-me-announce-2010-tour |title=Article announcing early 2010 tour dates |first=Phil |last=Freeman |date=October 28, 2009 |work=MSN Superfans |publisher=MSN |quote=Progressive metal band Between The Buried And Me, whose latest album, The Great Misdirect, hit stores yesterday, will be launching another one of those tours where the openers kick the headliner's ass night after night in early 2010. |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091030153924/http://music.msn.com/superfans/heavy-metal/blog/between-the-buried-and-me-announce-2010-tour/ |archive-date=October 30, 2009}} Afterwards, they traveled to Europe supporting [[Lamb of God (band)|Lamb of God]], along with [[Job for a Cowboy]] and [[August Burns Red]]. In February 2011, Between the Buried and Me were confirmed to play at the New England Metal & Hardcore Festival on Saturday, April 16 in Worcester, MA. They were main support for [[Hatebreed]]. In April and May 2011 they headlined a tour featuring Job for a Cowboy, [[The Ocean Collective|The Ocean]], and on select dates [[Cephalic Carnage]]. Between the Buried and Me stated their move from Victory to [[Metal Blade Records]]{{cite web |url=http://www.metalblade.com/english/news.php#btbam |title=Metal Blade News |publisher=Metalblade.com |access-date=July 4, 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110615193709/http://www.metalblade.com/english/news.php |archive-date=June 15, 2011}} and quickly released an EP entitled ''[[The Parallax: Hypersleep Dialogues]]'' on April 12, 2011.{{cite web |url=http://en.metalship.org/interviews/239-Between%20The%20Buried%20And%20Me |title=Between the Buried and Me Interview |work=Metalship |date=November 11, 2012 |access-date=November 20, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171002170031/http://en.metalship.org/interviews/239-Between%20The%20Buried%20And%20Me |archive-date=October 2, 2017 |url-status=dead }} In May, [[Victory Records]] announced the release of a [[greatest hits album]] as a three-disc set.{{cite web |url=http://www.victoryrecords.com/merch/packages/18094/Between_The_Buried_And_Me_The_Best_Of_Deluxe_Package_Deal |title=Between The Buried And Me: The Best Of Deluxe Package Deal |publisher=Victory Records |access-date=July 4, 2011}} On January 16, 2012, Between the Buried and Me revealed that work on the full-length second part to ''The Parallax'' had begun and was later released as ''[[The Parallax II: Future Sequence]]'' on October 9, 2012.{{cite web |last=Neilstein |first=Vince |title=BTBAM ARE WORKING ON PARALLAX PART II |url=http://www.metalsucks.net/2012/01/16/btbam-are-working-on-parallax-part-ii/ |publisher=[[MetalSucks]] |date=January 16, 2012 |access-date=January 25, 2012}} Between the Buried and Me also announced a headlining European tour beginning in [[Paris]] on September 2, 2011, and continuing throughout the mainland and into the UK, ending up in [[Moscow]] on September 30. The tour was supported by [[Animals as Leaders]]. In July 2011, the band announced their headlining North American "Saints&Sinners Tour" playing throughout November and December with [[Animals as Leaders]] and [[Tesseract (band)|TesseracT]]. The band created a few medleys just for this tour, and performed songs that they hadn't played in years. They co-headlined the 2012 [[Summer Slaughter]] under [[Cannibal Corpse]] with numerous other metal bands such as [[Exhumed (band)|Exhumed]], [[Job for a Cowboy]], [[The Faceless]], and [[Veil of Maya]], followed by a co-headlining tour through Europe and UK with [[Periphery (band)|Periphery]] and [[The Safety Fire]]. They also toured Japan and Australia with [[Animals as Leaders]] in November 2012.{{cite web |url=http://www.alliance-trax.com/tour/btbamaal.html |title=Alliance Trax |access-date=September 4, 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120906083320/http://www.alliance-trax.com/tour/btbamaal.html |archive-date=September 6, 2012 }} Starting in February 2013, they toured with [[Coheed and Cambria]]. In fall 2013 they embarked on The Future Sequence Tour, where they played ''The Parallax II: Future Sequence'' all the way through. Support was provided by [[The Faceless]], [[The Contortionist]], and [[The Safety Fire]]. On February 14, 2014, it was announced Between the Buried and Me would record and release a live album for ''The Parallax II: Future Sequence'', playing it in its entirety with additional instruments, including a saxophone, percussionists, flute, and a string quartet. The release, titled ''Future Sequence: Live at the Fidelitorium'', was released September 30, 2014. ===''Coma Ecliptic'' and ''Colors 10th Anniversary Tour'' (2015–2017)=== On March 17, 2015, they announced that ''[[Coma Ecliptic]]'' will be released through Metal Blade Records on July 7, 2015, and released a song titled "Memory Palace" on July 10. From 2015 - 2017, Between the Buried and Me went out on their ''Coma Ecliptic World Tour'' and headlined with / co-headlined for August Burns Red, Animals as Leaders, Devin Townsend Project, [[Fallujah (band)|Fallujah]], [[Enslaved (band)|Enslaved]], and [[The Contortionist]]. The band released "Coma Ecliptic: Live" on April 28, 2017, which has their entire ''Coma Ecliptic'' album played live in its entirety. In the fall of 2017, Between the Buried and Me toured for the ''Colors 10th Anniversary Tour'' where they performed the whole album.{{Cite web|url=https://loudwire.com/between-the-buried-and-me-colors-2017-north-american-tour/|title=Between the Buried and Me to Shred 'Colors' in Full on 2017 Tour|first=Graham|last=Hartmann|website=Loudwire.com}} ===''Automata'' and Sumerian Records (2018–2019)=== [[File:BTBAM2018.jpg|thumb|Between the Buried and Me performing in 2018|alt=]] Recording of the band's upcoming eighth full-length album began on July 31, 2017{{cite web |url=http://www.metalinjection.net/latest-news/between-the-buried-and-me-in-the-studio |title=BETWEEN THE BURIED AND ME Is In The Studio! |work=Metal Injection |last=Kennelty |first=Greg |date=August 1, 2017 |access-date=December 16, 2017}} and finished on September 6, with the release date scheduled in early 2018.{{cite web |url=http://www.metalinjection.net/upcoming-releases/between-the-buried-and-me-finishes-recording-its-new-album |title=BETWEEN THE BURIED AND ME Finishes Recording Its New Album |work=Metal Injection |last=Kennelty |first=Greg |date=September 8, 2017 |access-date=December 16, 2017}} On December 28, 2017, bassist Dan Briggs posted footage of a song they had finished recording separate from the eighth studio album completed in September 2017. It was later revealed to be their interpretation of [[The Dear Hunter]]'s track "The Tank" for an exclusive 7-inch split with the band.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/danbriggsx/status/946395140553367552|title=One day in the studio, one song recorded @paulbtbam #jamieking @btbamofficialpic.twitter.com/g9j9pUDebG|last=Briggs|first=Dan|date=December 28, 2017|website=Twitter.com|language=en|access-date=January 15, 2018}} In January 2018, the band announced ''Automata'', a two-part studio album. ''[[Automata I]]'' was announced a release date of March 9, 2018, via [[Sumerian Records]]. The second part, ''[[Automata II]]'', was released on July 13, 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.theprp.com/2018/04/12/news/between-the-buried-and-mes-automata-ii-set-for-july-release/|title=Between The Buried And Me's "Automata II" Set For July Release|publisher=ThePRP|access-date=April 12, 2018|date=April 12, 2018}} Their "Between the Buried and Me Spring 2018 Tour" was announced as well, spanning March 2 to April 7, 2018, across the contiguous United States. The tour would be supported by [[The Dear Hunter]] with special guests [[Leprous]]. Additionally, it was announced on the [[Tommy Giles Rogers Jr.|Thomas Giles]] Instagram how their exclusive split 7-inch single with The Dear Hunter would be available for VIP package buyers on the tour. The split 7-inch would contain each band recording their interpretation of an existing song from the other band.{{Cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BeD1p7VhHsr|title=Instagram post by Tommy Rogers • Jan 17, 2018 at 6:04pm UTC|website=Instagram.com|language=en|access-date=January 17, 2018}} [https://bibliogram.pussthecat.org/p/BeD1p7VhHsr Non-loginwalled link at bibliogram.pussthecat.org] The band then headlined the entire 2018 portion of the Summer Slaughter tour. They were joined up with bands such as [[Born of Osiris]], [[Veil of Maya]], [[Erra (band)|ERRA]], [[The Agony Scene]], [[Allegaeon]], [[Terror Universal]], [[Soreption]], and [[Entheos]]. In early 2019, they toured ''[[Automata II]]'' in the US beginning in February and ending in March. Opening acts were [[Astronoid]] and [[TesseracT]], except for a few dates. ===Postponed 20th anniversary tour and ''Colors II'' (2020–present)=== In spring 2020, the band was set to headline a 20th anniversary tour across North America, with the first set composed of songs spanning their career and the second set being ''The Great Misdirect'' performed in its entirety.{{Cite web|url=https://loudwire.com/between-the-buried-and-me-2020-tour-the-great-misdirect/|title=Between the Buried and Me Announce 2020 Tour, Will Play 'The Great Misdirect' in Full|first=Graham|last=Hartmann|website=Loudwire.com}} Due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], the band postponed the tour until it was safe to tour again.{{cite web|url=https://www.antimusic.com/news/20/March/26Between_The_Buried_And_Me_Postpone_20th_Anniversary_Tour.shtml|title=Between the Buried and Me Postpone 20th Anniversary Tour|publisher=antiMUSIC|date=March 26, 2020|access-date=June 17, 2020}} The tour was rebranded as a 21st anniversary tour in 2021 and kicked off in Atlanta on August 3 of that year. The band revealed on November 16, 2020, that they have been writing their upcoming tenth studio album and are recording it for a scheduled release sometime in 2021.{{cite web |last1=Pasbani |first1=Robert |title=BETWEEN THE BURIED AND ME Have Entered The Studio To Work on New Material |url=https://metalinjection.net/upcoming-releases/in-the-studio/between-the-buried-and-me-have-entered-the-studio-to-work-on-new-material |website=Metal Injection |access-date=November 16, 2020 |date=November 16, 2020}} On June 24, 2021, the band announced the release of their new album ''[[Colors II]]'' (follow-up to 2007's [[Colors (Between the Buried and Me album)|''Colors'']]) through SiriusXM's Liquid Metal channel. The album was released on August 20, 2021.{{cite web |title=BETWEEN THE BURIED AND ME Announces 'Colors II' Album |url=https://blabbermouth.net/news/between-the-buried-and-me-announces-colors-ii-album/ |website=BLABBERMOUTH.NET |access-date=June 29, 2021 |date=June 25, 2021}} The album's first single, "Fix the Error", was released online on June 25, 2021, along with a music video on July 7.{{cite web|publisher=The Prp|url=https://www.theprp.com/2021/06/24/news/between-the-buried-and-me-to-release-colors-ii-in-august/|title=Between The Buried And Me To Release "Colors II" was released on August|date=June 24, 2021|accessdate=June 24, 2021}} == Musical style and influences == Between the Buried and Me's general musical style has been stated by critics to be primarily a blend of [[progressive metal]],{{citation|title=Between the Buried and Me – The Parallax II: Future Sequence |publisher=Ghost Cult Magazine |date=October 14, 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.indyweek.com/indyweek/between-the-buried-and-me-and-their-progeny-provide-a-counterpoint-to-southern-metal/Content?oid=3239189 |title=Between The Buried And Me and their progeny provide a counterpoint to Southern metal |publisher=Bryan C. Reed |date=January 9, 2013}}{{cite web |url=https://www.sputnikmusic.com/review/9030/Between-the-Buried-and-Me-The-Silent-Circus/ |title=Between the Buried and Me – The Silent Circus (staff review) |publisher=[[Sputnik]] |date=September 5, 2006}}{{cite web |url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/the-great-misdirect-mw0001334080 |title=The Great Misdirect – Between the Buried and Me |publisher=[[Allmusic]]}}{{cite web |url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/the-parallax-hypersleep-dialogues-mw0002117248 |title=The Parallax: Hypersleep Dialogues – Between the Buried and Me |publisher=[[Allmusic]]}} [[technical death metal]],{{cite web |url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/the-parallax-ii-future-sequence-mw0002417464 |title=The Parallax II: Future Sequence – Between the Buried and Me |publisher=[[Allmusic]]}}{{cite web |url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/colors-mw0000748690 |title=Colors – Between the Buried and Me |publisher=[[Allmusic]]}} [[progressive metalcore]],{{cite web |last1=Rivadavia |first1=Eduardo |title=15 Best Metal Albums of 2009 |url=http://loudwire.com/best-metal-albums-2009/ |website=Loudwire.com |access-date=January 3, 2019 |language=en}}{{cite web|url=http://www.prog-sphere.com/specials/btbam-albums-ranked/|title=BETWEEN THE BURIED AND ME Albums Ranked|date=June 4, 2018|website=Prog-sphere.com|access-date=January 17, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://consequenceofsound.net/2015/07/album-review-between-the-buried-and-me-coma-ecliptic/|title=Album Review: Between The Buried And Me - Coma |url=http://loudwire.com/between-the-buried-and-me-guitarists-close-up-performances-telos/ |title=Between the Buried and Me Guitarists Unveil Close-Up Performances of New Song 'Telos' |publisher=[[Loudwire]] |author=Graham Hartmann |date=October 3, 2012 |access-date=March 24, 2014}}{{cite web |title=Between the Buried and Me: The Parallax: Hypersleep Dialogues | Music Review | Slant Magazine |url=https://www.slantmagazine.com/music/review/between-the-buried-and-me-the-parallax-hypersleep-dialogues/2477 |publisher=[[Slant Magazine]] |author=Matthew Cole |date=April 19, 2011 |access-date=March 24, 2014}} and [[metalcore]]{{cite web |author=Sharpe-Young, Garry |title=Between the Buried and Me |url=http://www.musicmight.com/artist/united+states/north+carolina/raleigh/between+the+buried+and+me |publisher=[[MusicMight]] |access-date=July 21, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091020155840/http://www.musicmight.com/artist/united+states/north+carolina/raleigh/between+the+buried+and+me |archive-date=October 20, 2009 |url-status=dead }}{{cite web |author=Donnelly, Dave |title=''Colors'' review |url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/colors-mw0000748690 |work=Allmusic |publisher=Rovi Company |access-date=July 21, 2009}}{{cite web |author=Morris, Kurt |title=''The Silent Circus'' review |url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/the-silent-circus-mw0000319174 |work=Allmusic |publisher=Rovi Company |access-date=July 21, 2009}} along with various musical styles: "One minute the band may be playing [[thrash metal]] and the next they're flowing into [[death growl|death metal growls]] and thick guitar riffs... the metal take on things can seemingly change in a flash as lead singer Tommy Rogers fleshes out his vocals and utilizes the keyboards to create something that sounds more like it should be on a [[The Smashing Pumpkins|Smashing Pumpkins]] album". On the band's cover album, ''[[The Anatomy Of]]'', the band pays tribute to many of their diverse influences, including [[Sepultura]], [[Metallica]], [[Blind Melon]], [[Mötley Crüe]], [[Queen (band)|Queen]], [[King Crimson]], [[Soundgarden]], [[Faith No More]], [[Pantera]], [[Pink Floyd]], [[Depeche Mode]], [[Earth Crisis]], and [[The Smashing Pumpkins]].{{cite web |url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/between-the-buried-and-me-mn0000399190 |title=Between the Buried and Me Biography |work=Allmusic |publisher=Rovi Company |access-date=May 21, 2007}} ==Band Dialogues]]'' (EP, 2011) ==Other projects== * Tommy Giles Rogers has an [[electronica]] side project named Giles. A music video for the song "Slumber Party" is featured on the DVD that is included on the re-release for Between the Buried and Me's second album ''[[The Silent Circus]]''. Rogers also released a solo album on February 1, 2011, entitled [[Pulse (Thomas Giles album)|''Pulse'']]. The album is credited under the name Thomas Giles. Also, under the name Thomas Giles, he released "Modern Noise" in November 2014 and "Velcro Kid" in November 2016. In 2018 he released the album ''Don't Touch the Outside''. * Dustie Waring and Blake Richardson are members of the [[deathcore]] band [[Glass Casket]]. * Rogers and Jacob Troth run a clothing line named Jacob Rogers. * Dan Briggs and members of [[Fear Before]] and [[Abigail Williams (band)|Abigail Williams]] are members of an experimental [[Supergroup (music)|supergroup]] named [[Orbs (band)|Orbs]]. * Shane Blay is now in the bands [[Oh, Sleeper]] and [[Wovenwar]] and was formerly in the band Evelynn. * Dan Briggs, along with Walter Fancourt (Casual Curious, Brand New Life) and Matt Lynch (Eyris) are members of a progressive rock/jazz fusion band named Trioscapes who are also signed under [[Metal Blade Records]]. As of 2020, they have released two albums. In 2012 they released their debut album ''Separate Realities'', followed by ''Digital Dream Sequence'' in 2014. * Dan Briggs, along with Richard Henshall ([[Haken (band)|Haken]]), Matt Lynch, and Pete Jones, are in a supergroup, Nova Collective, which has released one instrumental jazz fusion album, ''The Further Side''.{{cite web |url=https://www.metalblade.com/novacollective/ |title=NOVA COLLECTIVE - The Further Side |publisher=Metal Blade Records |access-date=July 17, 2018}} * Dan Briggs has an experimental solo project called Nightmare Scenario and released his debut EP ''Beyond What Is Real'' in 2019. * Jason Roe is now in [[Society's Finest]] and formerly was in Evelynn. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.betweentheburiedandme.com/}} {{Between the Buried and Me}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Heavy metal musical groups from North Carolina]] [[Category:American progressive metal musical groups]] [[Category:American metalcore musical groups]] [[Category:American mathcore musical groups]] [[Category:American death metal musical groups]] [[Category:American technical death metal musical groups]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 2000]] [[Category:Victory Records artists]] [[Category:Metal Blade Records artists]] [[Category:Sumerian Records artists]] [[Category:Musical quintets]] [[Category:Musical groups from North Carolina]] [[Category:Musical groups from Raleigh, North Carolina]]
